note.html:
I'm eager to learn more about
CS (Computer Science, not Counter-Strike)
and logic programming in particular.

In the past, I've worked for small-to-medium companies
in the Greater Metropolitan Paris Area ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡·
(and also in Stuttgart ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ª and Budapest ğŸ‡­ğŸ‡º).

Today, I can provide you with consulting services
as a part-time freelance software developer.

content.html:
I love my name because over email people assume I'm a white man who went to prep school and then they meet me in person and realize I tricked them into respecting me for 6 months.

â€” Cooper (@Cooperstreaming) September 22, 2022

Got kind of the reverse feeling b/c of last name.
In high school, it was common for friends,
teachers to call me Mâ€¦
given than â€¦ well it was my name.

Kind of hated it at times, hence had more than
a few androgyne nicknames to overcome the feeling.

Today when receiving emails from strangers,
whenever they rotate those names,
it feels better since i came to realize when,
where that feeling orginates.

Shaming children for things they didn't ask
for may make some question the essence
of what makes identities feels real.

It was also only much later than I came to learn of
some of said-buddhist views (probably westernized, if i dare say)
regarding what we may perceive as an aggregate
of self or an identity https://w.wiki/5jhT
(`Skandha` or something according to the article).

It struck something in me like lightning, âš¡
if i may express it that way. Why?
It also happened that i went into reading
few things about domain driven design
and there were those concepts of aggregates and clusters.
DDD aggregate article authored by Martin Fowler

Â For some ?(un)fortunate reason, it clicked in a way in
helping to visualize what those craving,
clinging materials could be and how they associate,
relate to each other, could be seen as fragmented
or enticing in one's mind given the optics, we'd decide to pickâ€¦ ğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜´

Related links :

  • https://w.wiki/5jhT

Tags:

  • #domain
    • #driven
      • #design
  • #naming
  • #selves

content.html:
TL;DR Installation script

I eventually figured how to find motivation
to install Eagle Mode by reading its documentation
so that optional dependencies are fully leveraged,
less than 4 ans years later ğŸ’ªğŸ¼,
(not suffering from inertia at all)

Conclusion: please don't be hasty

Â 

Who needs the whateverses, when you can just browse a linux filesystem
in some ~orderly fashions with Eagle Mode :P

Thank you Andre Staltz for showing us the way since this publication of yours:

Yep. All the way down to the bytes of each file, if you wish. pic.twitter.com/DT3vGodrR6

â€” AndrÃ© Staltz (@andrestaltz) December 31, 2018

[â€¦]

It turned out that I missed a third party repository,
mentioning circa 2019 that probonopd/eaglemode exists,
from the 2018 thread above ğŸ¤¯
(publication since deleted by its author, hence redacted below).

Â 

It was only after intending to thank
the author (Oliver Hamann) from the project forum
that i had this realized.

Related links :

  • Eagle Mode's video demonstration

Tags:

  • #eagle
    • #mode
  • #filesystem
  • #linux
